That's right, listen up!
I took my two children and went near the coast,
thinking of picking up some shells for them.
But then, 
in the bushes or the shadows of the rocks—
somewhere in the darkness—
there was something staring at us.
It gave me the creeps, so we hurried back home.

Just a moment ago, around Breya Coast,
I found traces of an enemy...
But I got scared and retreated.
It's truly shameful
that despite wanting to overcome my timidity
and become an Arisen,
I am still so cowardly.

column4:

so we moved to this place with a relatively 
stable climate where we can see the sea.
But never did we expect to encounter such a 
terrifying thing.
We were so shocked that we ran away in a panic,
our bodies trembling with fear.
I can't relax and rest properly here.

there are ignorant Arisen who become complacent 
in their position. 

In that regard, Gurdolin has a different spirit. 
That man is a true Arisen who never lacks in 
training and ambition. 
If you have the opportunity, 
it would be good to speak with him. 
There is no better example to learn from than him.

there was a slightly hesitant Arisen. 
Those who shy away from jumping into danger 
and rely on others, 
how will they ever amount to anything? 
What is the purpose of "living forever"? 

Well, it's troublesome when someone recklessly 
plunges in without thinking ahead, though.

when I go to different parts of Lestania to check 
on the condition of my comrades.

troubled by frequent monster attacks. 
The hardships of the battlefield are best known 
by the leaders on the ground. 
I want to support them as much as possible, but 
manpower shortage is a serious issue everywhere. 
In these circumstances, 
it is necessary to cooperate with the Arisen.
